blocks.name: canth
blocks.content: No set ` A ` is equinumerous to its power set (Cantor's theorem), i.e. no function can map ` A ` it onto its power set. Compare Theorem 6B(b) of [Enderton] p. 132. For the equinumerosity version, see ~ canth2 . Note that ` A ` must be a set: this theorem does not hold when ` A ` is too large to be a set; see ~ ncanth for a counterexample. (Use ~ nex if you want the form ` -. E. f f : A -onto-> ~P A ` .) (Contributed by NM, 7-Aug-1994.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jun-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm canth(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wn(wfo(c0, c1, cpw(c1)))
  -| wcel(c1, universe)
} = {
  pm2.65i(wfo(c0, c1, cpw(c1)), wcel(crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))), crn(c0)))
  syl5eleqr(crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))), crn(c0), cpw(c1), wfo(c0, c1, cpw(c1)))
  elpwi2(crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))), c1, universe)
  ssrab2(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))))
  forn(c0, c1, cpw(c1))
  mtbiri(wfo(c0, c1, cpw(c1)), wcel(crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))), crn(c0)), wrex(hs1, c1, wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))))))
  nrex(hs1, c1, wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))))))
  nsyl(wcel(cv(hs1), c1), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))))), wb(wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))))))
  sylib(wcel(cv(hs1), c1), wn(wb(wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))))))), wb(wn(wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))), wcel(cv(hs1), crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))))))
  baibr(wcel(cv(hs1), c1), wn(wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))), wcel(cv(hs1), crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))))))
  elrab(hs0, cv(hs1), c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), wn(wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))))
  notbid(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))
  eleq12d(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cv(hs1), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  id(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), c0)
  nbbn(wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))))))
  eleq2(cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))), cv(hs1))
  syl(wfo(c0, c1, cpw(c1)), wb(wcel(crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))), crn(c0)), wrex(hs1, c1, wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))))))), wfn(c0, c1))
  fofn(c0, c1, cpw(c1))
  fvelrnb(hs1, c0, c1, crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(hs1))
  diff.hs0.w(wn(wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(crab(hs0, c1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))))
}

  âŠ£ c1 âˆˆ ğ•Œ
} = {
  pm2.65i((c0 : c1 â†  P(c1)), { hs0 âˆˆ c1 | Â¬ hs0 âˆˆ(c0 ` hs0)} âˆˆ ran(c0))

  notbid(hs0 = hs1, hs0 âˆˆ(c0 ` hs0), hs1 âˆˆ(c0 ` hs1))
  eleq12d(hs0, (c0 ` hs0), hs1, (c0 ` hs1), hs0 = hs1)
  id(hs0 = hs1)
  fveq2(hs0, hs1, c0)
  nbbn(hs1 âˆˆ(c0 ` hs1), hs1 âˆˆ { hs0 âˆˆ c1 | Â¬ hs0 âˆˆ(c0 ` hs0)})
  eleq2((c0 ` hs1), { hs0 âˆˆ c1 | Â¬ hs0 âˆˆ(c0 ` hs0)}, hs1)
  syl((c0 : c1 â†  P(c1)), ({ hs0 âˆˆ c1 | Â¬ hs0 âˆˆ(c0 ` hs0)} âˆˆ ran(c0)â†” âˆƒ(hs1 âˆˆ c1,(c0 ` hs1)= { hs0 âˆˆ c1 | Â¬ hs0 âˆˆ(c0 ` hs0)})), c0[Fn]c1)
  fofn(c0, c1, P(c1))
  fvelrnb(hs1, c0, c1, { hs0 âˆˆ c1 | Â¬ hs0 âˆˆ(c0 ` hs0)})
  diff.hs0.c(c1)

  diff.hs1.c(c0)

  diff.hs1.c({ hs0 âˆˆ c1 | Â¬ hs0 âˆˆ(c0 ` hs0)})
}

blocks.name: ncanth
blocks.content: Cantor's theorem fails for the universal class (which is not a set but a proper class by ~ vprc ). Specifically, the identity function maps the universe onto its power class. Compare ~ canth that works for sets. See also the remark in ~ ru about NF, in which Cantor's theorem fails for sets that are "too large." This theorem gives some intuition behind that failure: in NF the universal class is a set, and it equals its own power set. (Contributed by NM, 29-Jun-2004.)
